Labehe Nature Reserve is a river gorge on the Laba River (or Laba He) in Erlangshan National Park.
Subtropical forests include extensive bamboo groves.
Subtropical climate, with a high chance of rain and fog in spring and summer.
The park is currently closed due to the danger of falling rocks (as at 10 June 2010). Authorities expect it to open again in 2010.
There is an entry fee to the park.
The main activity in the park is hiking.
There are hotels in the park.
Camping is not permitted in the park.
It is best to talk to your hotel to arrange transport to Luding or Ya'an.
